formattedAddress: 145 E 49th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 145 E 49th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

editorialSummary.text: Rustic Italian fare from wood-fired pizza to classic pastas on offer in this cozy Kosher kitchen.

originalText.text: What a great place to eat. Although kosher, have to say that the food was savory, portion savy and service was attentive & helpful. Suggest the watermelon sangria.. sooo tasty.

text.text: What a great place to eat. Although kosher, have to say that the food was savory, portion savy and service was attentive & helpful. Suggest the watermelon sangria.. sooo tasty.

originalText.text:
Best kosher dairy restaurant in the US and second in the world (Baghetto Dairy Rome may be the only thing better).

Service is impeccable/fast and every dish is delicious, particularly the sunchoke soup, every pizza and dessert. I’ve ordered the whole menu and it’s the only restaurant I like returning to multiple times.

If there was any negative, it’s the lack of a liquor license - cocktails would make this place even more incredible.

text.text:

originalText.text: If you go to Abaita you will find a great location with a pleasant atmosphere and a Kosher menu with a variety of tasty dishes. Multiple vegetarian options are available. The service was very friendly and efficient. "Abaita", in Hebrew, can mean "going home", highlighting the sense of comfort, warmth and casualty one may feel when returning home. You will have a great time dining here but their classy gourmet dishes and the check will probably get you into your NYC foodie mode more than anything else.

text.text: If you go to Abaita you will find a great location with a pleasant atmosphere and a Kosher menu with a variety of tasty dishes. Multiple vegetarian options are available. The service was very friendly and efficient. "Abaita", in Hebrew, can mean "going home", highlighting the sense of comfort, warmth and casualty one may feel when returning home. You will have a great time dining here but their classy gourmet dishes and the check will probably get you into your NYC foodie mode more than anything else.

originalText.text: Abaita is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. If you want to try one of the best pizzas in NYC, From the traditional Pizza Margherita to Abaita's own Pizza Picante, you’ll find an amazing taste in each bite. If you’re looking for organic, homemade, delicious food with the best customer service and environment, Abaita is the place to go.

text.text: Abaita is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. If you want to try one of the best pizzas in NYC, From the traditional Pizza Margherita to Abaita's own Pizza Picante, you’ll find an amazing taste in each bite. If you’re looking for organic, homemade, delicious food with the best customer service and environment, Abaita is the place to go.

originalText.text:
OMG! My visit began with the undisputed star of the menu, the classic pizza margherita. Abaita's rendition of this timeless favorite was a symphony of flavors, showcasing a level of perfection that has earned the restaurant its esteemed reputation. Venturing further into the menu, we sampled the classic spaghetti, a comforting and authentic delight, satisfied our cravings for traditional flavors. What made it taste even better was the idea that all the pasta was made from scratch onsite.

The restaurant is cozy and bustling with chatter from all the other satisfied customers.

The Abaita Apple Cake for dessert is a sweet symphony that perfectly concludes the culinary journey at this extraordinary establishment. Layers of moist, cinnamon-infused apple cake are skillfully stacked, creating a delightful treat that captures the essence of autumnal comfort. What elevates this dessert to a level of sheer indulgence is the drizzling of honey syrup—an elegant touch that adds a natural sweetness, seamlessly complementing the tender apples. Each forkful is a harmonious blend of textures and flavors, further enhanced by the velvety richness of the accompanying crème fraîche. It's a dessert that not only satisfies the sweet tooth but leaves a lasting impression, embodying the culinary mastery that defines Abaita's delectable offerings.
